BR_text.BRsummary: [Python] jsonschema included twice in setup.py requires list.
BR_text.BRdescription:
<denchmark-h:h3>What is the problem?</denchmark-h>
 
  is included twice in the Python package <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ray-project/ray/blob/master/python/setup.py#L176-L183>setup.py requires list</denchmark-link>
 .  This is causing the usage of the Ray Python library within Bazel to fail during the analysis phase due to label duplication in the generated  target's :
 <denchmark-code>ERROR: .../external/requirements_py3_pypi__ray_0_9_0_dev0/BUILD:6:1: Label '@requirements_py3_pypi__jsonschema_3_2_0//:pkg' is duplicated in the 'deps' attribute of rule 'pkg'
 </denchmark-code>
 
 This bug was introduced in the <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ray-project/ray/pull/7261/files#diff-8cf6167d58ce775a08acafcfe6f40966>cluster json schema validator PR</denchmark-link>
 .
 Ray version and other system information (Python version, TensorFlow version, OS):
 Ray master commit <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ray-project/ray/commit/90b553ed058a546e036374cd0919e00604892514>90b553e</denchmark-link>
  (most recent commit as of this issue filing)
 <denchmark-h:h3>Reproduction (REQUIRED)</denchmark-h>
 
 
  I have verified my script runs in a clean environment and reproduces the issue.
  I have verified the issue also occurs with the latest wheels.
